summary: Federal agencies are required by law to provide a variety of programs and services to tribes and their members. The Office of Management and Budget publishes an annual report (called a "crosscut") on federal funding for programs that benefit Native Americans, but tribal stakeholders have expressed concerns about the report's transparency. We found that agency data shown in the report lacks details about what it...
title: Tribal Funding: Actions Needed to Improve Information on Federal Funds That Benefit Native Americans
